// Stepping straight through the program.

-> _ = "breakpoint"
(godebug) n
-> x = mul(x, x)
(godebug) x
4
(godebug) p x
4
(godebug) s
-> var x int
(godebug) x
Command not recognized, sorry!
(godebug) p x
x is not in scope (or is in package scope). Can't print it.
(godebug) n
-> for i := 0; i < m; i++ {
(godebug) x
0
(godebug) i
Command not recognized, sorry!
(godebug) p m
4
(godebug) n
-> x = add(x, m)
(godebug) x
0
(godebug) i
0
(godebug) m
4
(godebug) n
-> for i := 0; i < m; i++ {
(godebug) x
4
(godebug) p i
1
(godebug) p m
4
(godebug) p n
4
(godebug) n
-> x = add(x, m)
(godebug) x
4
(godebug) n
-> for i := 0; i < m; i++ {
(godebug) x
8
(godebug) p i
2
(godebug) n
-> x = add(x, m)
(godebug) n
-> for i := 0; i < m; i++ {
(godebug) i
3
(godebug) n
-> x = add(x, m)
(godebug) n
-> for i := 0; i < m; i++ {
(godebug) i
4
(godebug) m
4
(godebug) x
16
(godebug) n
-> return x
(godebug) x
16
(godebug) n
-> if x == 4 {
(godebug) x
16
(godebug) n
-> } else if n := 2; n == 3 {
(godebug) n
-> } else {
(godebug) n
-> fmt.Println("What's going on? x ==", x)
(godebug) x
16
(godebug) n
What's going on? x == 16
